column4: anyone got a wpc54g  wireless pcmcia card working without ndiswrapper?
ya...it all seems everyone using ndiswrapper with it ;(
If you don't want ndiswrapper, you need Ubuntu dapper.
Then you need the bcm43xx firmware package
What builtin one do you have?
there is no need to fetch newer kernels off kernel.org, the Ubuntu guys backport the latest 43xx driver stuff into the Ubuntu kernels.
No, wifi-radar doesn't work with bcm43xx
DIsab;e bcm43xx, use ndiswrapper. It will work just fine.
: i just blacklisted the bcm43xx  so i should be good then.... is it still gonna be a problem with the rate speed
or is that just on broadcom
why o why does it have to be me ;(    lmao
ndiswrapper -i lsbcmnds.inf   from the wpc54gv2 windoz drivers....then i ran ndiswrapper -l  and says driver present..but doesn't say hardware present ;(
